snippet.textDisplay: A very honest assessment.  You are right; a number of Everton players aren't up to the job and the five you mentioned come into that category.  The problem is that in the January transfer window it is going to be difficult to sign five new players, each of whom are going to need to hit the ground running.  Maybe Ancelotti could sign two key players and combine them with the best of his U23 squad.  I am sure the supporters would get behind such a team.  I'm a lifelong red but having lived away from my home city for many years I want reds and blues to do well.

Huge home support - huge away support and a passion that most other clubs would die for. DCL scores a couple of goals and suddenly the lad is the Messiah. He's shite and will never be a top class striker while has a hole in his arse. Richarleson - big lazy fucker who spends more time on his arse. snippet.textDisplay: Yes, I'm just as dismayed about that performance as you, don't agree with everything you say, but most of it. Some of our defensive players in the second half became headless chickens, and our two midfielders went missing! I don't buy all about the players being tired and out of energy, its their job, all they have to do is play football and they get payed handsomely for it!! Shockingly bad performance was that, very annoying and disappointing.

snippet.textDisplay: It is a truth that passion goes a long way when playing football, it was devoid in one team and overflowing in the other, Everton had the better players, most of them internationals but they were outfought by young lads who were playing for their futures.  I have never rated Pickford and the Liverpool goalkeeper who didn't even have a team when they stumbled on him is ten times better, the blues should go after him, feel for Coleman as he was once a decent player but I don't think he has recovered from his injuries,  I have watched Charlison a few times but still cannot decide if he is a player or not, he is for politenesses sake inconsistent,  It was strange with the January window that those that want to leave would have put in a show, that those that want to stay would do the same, frankly, Carlo has a huge job deciding which of these players he could trust to put in a performance during the rest of the season,  on the evidence here he doesn't have many,  I doubt many top players if they saw this game would want to join Everton at the moment, or they would want over the top wages, sad because the fans deserve better than this, I would back my side every step of the way if I knew they were doing their best, these players seemed unconcerned and that to any fan is criminal!

snippet.textDisplay: Surely, this has to be the nadir in mine and many others lives as an Evertonian. I was 3 when we last won at Anfield, 14 when we last beat them and 17 when we last lead a game against them in November 2013!   Until we actually wake up and realise that we need wholesale change from top to the bottom of the club in personnel and in the culture of the club, we will continue to be in the wilderness for many years and decades to come.

snippet.textDisplay: Bees fan (Brentford)here. Fair play to you for facing the music, can't be easy to come here and to talk about your team no-show performance today. Speaking as a neutral and having watched the game, I think you were 100% spot on, some of your players ARE a disgrace to the shirt; however, you said one thing that I suppose all Evertonians must be feeling; the fact that Jurgen Klopp was cheeky enough to play a team of youngsters - 6 of whom were under the age of 21, in a Merseyside derby, plus one or two fringe players, and still managed beat you was in my view truly insulting and humiliating - Klopp knew exactly what he was doing and he purposely knew how catastrophic and crushing it would be for Evertonians everywhere, especially losing to your bitter inexperienced rivals. No doubt the next few days will be unbearable for the blue side of Merseyside, but things will get better. Good luck in your future as I'm more than certain Ancelotti WILL put things right in the next year or so.

snippet.textDisplay:
I honestly dont understand the criticism of gylfi siggurtson. He is a number 10 being asked to play as a holding midfielder. He's been told that he is not alowes to go forward. He's a creative player who is basically being asked to be a work horse. What do u honestly expect ?

And people can say "o but he's been shite all season even when he was a number 10". Well who hasnt ? Seriously who hasnt been shite for everton this season ? They all have. Under silva he was playing for a shit manager in a losing team. Of course his form isnt gonna be great this season. Then under dunc and carlo he's been ask to transform into this work horse

If you want to judge gylfi judge him when he is playing in his correct position. Last season i think he was only behind erikson in terms of goals and assists. Wot does that tell u ?

Gylfi's strenghs are his technique and touch, his quick creative brain, his link up play in and around the box and not forgetting his GOALS !

That goal that lpool scored today siggurtson has scored about 10 of them in a blue shirt. He does it with ease. Look at the goal v west ham. Only bern on pitch for couple minutes and he pulls that out the bag. Its natural to him

Tbh as soon as I saw the lineup I knew we were done fo!
All the pressure was on us+ if we won the lfc fans would say it was our youth team and everyone would of made nothing about it.
Also as soon as they scored the commentary said when lfc have scored 1st in the last 51 derbies they have Won 49 drew 2, so basically that was it. And we saw no reaction form any of the players no shots on target. Let’s face it Liverpool need to put out their u9s for us to have a chance.
I agree with you ped this feels worst as fan than getting battered 5-2 to the full strength 1st in the league team, even if it is a 96 or whatever winner, this feels awful as a fan. We haven’t won at Anfield in just over 2 decades and probably won’t get a better chance than that in a decade...
We can forget about beating Liverpool forever now, that was there youth team and this was our
“1st” team...mmmmmmmmmmm
Something isn’t quite right at the moment.........
Oh ye and I have never seen us win at Anfield, I wasn’t born + I was 4 or 5 when we last even won.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree with everything said here except one thing: "Put Holgate in centre mid and get a centre half to replace him" What are you smoking? Holgate is at best a Championship mid-table defender starting games for this proud club. Abysmal. It all comes down to one thing. This is a team of mercenaries. I've said it before and I'll say it again: This is a team, maybe even a club, full of players who walk out onto the pitch in a Merseyside Effing Derby (!) and play like it's any given Sunday against a Prem relegation team. They've got NO clue about what it is they are representing. The proud history they are writing a new chapter of, or the ghosts of previous Derbies that are looking on. Top to bottom, that squad is easily the most overrated in the Premier League. And critically, you said it: No leaders. No leader in goal, defence, midfield or attack. No one to take that team by the scruff and say "WTF? Play like your lives and careers depend on it!" They went 1-0 down, and got WORSE! Everton don't just need to get rid of 5 to 10 players, they need a complete squad overhaul. Too many bumper payday clowns who MIGHT get a game in another Prem starting eleven. MIGHT! The only consolation was that I didn't pay a penny to watch that game. My heart cries for the folks shelling out hundreds to buy season tickets to this tragedy. I was at Wembley in 1995 for our proudest moment in 25 years. Today might be the lowest point in that time span. Ancelotti could be forgiven for handing back his contract tonight under a 14 day Returns Policy, and I would not blame him!
